alert.note: Alert for Kent; Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 11:00PM EDT until July 29 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sussex County in southern Delaware... Southeastern Kent County in central Delaware... Southeastern Caroline County in eastern Maryland... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1100 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hurlock, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Milford, Seaford, Millsboro, Laurel, Lewes, Federalsburg, Milton, Bridgeville, Delmar, Preston, Ellendale, Henlopen Acres, Smithville, Cape Henlopen State Park, Agner, Sycamore, Big Stone Beach, Long Neck and Blades. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
